decks.notes: This deck focuses on playing aggressive creatures like Death's Shadow and Nethergoyf early in the game, while using cards like Mishra's Bauble and Street Wraith to control the opponent's resources. The plan is to deal damage quickly and efficiently, using removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Fatal Push to clear the way for your creatures. Detective's Phoenix and Dragon's Rage Channeler can provide extra value and card advantage, while Thoughtseize helps disrupt the opponent's game plan. The mana base is built to support the aggressive strategy, with a mix of fetch lands and shock lands.

The main idea of this Golgari Aggro deck is to take advantage of powerful early game threats like Tarmogoyf and Nethergoyf, while disrupting the opponent with hand disruption spells like Thoughtseize and removal spells like Fatal Push. Additionally, the deck utilizes artifacts like Mishra's Bauble and Urza's Saga to generate card advantage and tempo. The inclusion of cards like Shadowspear and Witherbloom Command also allows for flexibility and adaptation to different matchups. Overall, the key strategy is to apply early pressure, disrupt the opponent's game plan, and close out the game quickly.

The main concept of this Dimir Control deck is to efficiently control the opponent's board and hand while gradually generating card advantage through powerful spells and creatures. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan with counterspells like Counterspell and Force of Negation, removal like Fatal Push and Toxic Deluge, and hand disruption like Sink into Stupor. Murktide Regent and Psychic Frog provide strong threats on the board, while card selection and filtering is achieved through spells like Preordain and Consider. Overall, the deck focuses on maintaining control of the game until it can secure a win condition.

The deck focuses on quickly ramping up Merfolk creatures on the battlefield with the help of lords like Lord of Atlantis and Master of the Pearl Trident. It utilizes disruptive elements like Tide Shaper and Vodalian Hexcatcher to control the opponent's board, while Svyelun of Sea and Sky provides additional card advantage. Aether Vial allows for cheating creatures into play, while Flare of Denial and Force of Negation provide protection for key spells. The deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a fast-paced aggro strategy, backed up by creatures with powerful tribal synergies.

This deck focuses on quickly playing aggressive creatures and using burn spells to deal damage to the opponent. The deck includes a companion card to provide additional flexibility. The mana base is carefully constructed to support a wide range of colors for the spells in the deck. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with fast, efficient threats while maintaining strong control over the game with disruptive spells.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize the Amulet of Vigor along with Primeval Titan and The One Ring to quickly ramp up mana and search for key lands such as Urza's Saga, Boseiju, Who Endures, and Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle. By combining the power of land tutors like Expedition Map and Tolaria West with cards like Dryad of the Ilysian Grove and Lotus Field, the deck aims to generate explosive plays and overwhelm the opponent with versatile threats and powerful combo interactions.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on using fast, aggressive creatures and powerful spells to overwhelm the opponent quickly. With a mix of efficient creatures like Amped Raptor and Guide of Souls, as well as burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Galvanic Discharge, the deck aims to close out the game before the opponent has a chance to stabilize. The inclusion of cards like Blood Moon and Static Prison help to disrupt the opponent's game plan while cards like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah provide additional value and utility. Jegantha, the Wellspring serves as a useful companion option for additional mana acceleration.

This deck focuses on utilizing ramp spells and mana acceleration to quickly cast powerful Eldrazi creatures, such as Emrakul, the Promised End and World Breaker, to take control of the game. It also includes cards that can disrupt the opponent's strategy, such as Kozilek's Command and Malevolent Rumble, while also providing ways to tutor for key pieces with cards like Ancient Stirrings. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with big threats while also having answers to deal with opposing threats, making it a versatile and powerful control deck.

The deck focuses on utilizing various instant spells and Atraxa's ability to reanimate powerful creatures like Ulamog and Griselbrand from the graveyard quickly. By combining cards like Goryo's Vengeance, Ephemerate, and Tainted Indulgence, the deck can control the board and generate strong explosive plays, while also having disruptive elements like Force of Negation and Thoughtseize to protect its combo pieces. The deck also includes some removal options like Solitude and Prismatic Ending to deal with threats, creating a versatile strategy that can win games through both fast combos and attrition.

The deck focuses on quickly reanimating powerful creatures from the graveyard using cards like Goryo's Vengeance and Tainted Indulgence. It also has a control element with cards like Thoughtseize and Force of Negation to disrupt the opponent's game plan. Atraxa, Grand Unifier serves as a way to protect key combo pieces and generate value. The deck aims to quickly assemble its combo pieces and overwhelm the opponent with powerful creatures like Griselbrand and Ulamog, the Defiler. It also utilizes Ephemerate to reuse key creatures and protect them from removal.

The deck focuses on using instant reanimation spells like Goryo's Vengeance to quickly bring back powerful creatures like Griselbrand or Ulamog, the Defiler. Fallaji Archaeologist and Psychic Frog offer additional reanimation options. Utilizing cards like Ephemerate and Force of Negation for protection, the goal is to quickly assemble a game-winning combo using Atraxa, Grand Unifier's ability to create a dominant board state. The deck also includes disruption elements like Thoughtseize and Prismatic Ending to control the game. The mana base is designed to support a variety of color requirements for the deck's spells.

This Mardu Aggro deck focuses on quick and aggressive creature plays combined with burn spells to deal damage to the opponent as fast as possible. With a mix of efficient creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury, along with powerful burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Galvanic Discharge, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent before they have a chance to stabilize. Additionally, with cards like Static Prison to control the board and Ajani, Nacatl Pariah for added creature support, this deck has the tools to maintain pressure and secure a victory.

This deck focuses on quickly deploying aggressive creatures and using a mix of removal spells and disruptive cards to control the board and push for damage. The inclusion of Jegantha as a companion provides additional mana acceleration and flexibility. By efficiently utilizing the synergy between creatures, removal spells, and disruption, this deck aims to overwhelm opponents and secure victories by outpacing and outmaneuvering them. Additionally, the mana base is carefully constructed to support the aggressive game plan and maximize consistency in casting spells.

Utilizing the powerful UrzaTron lands, this deck aims to control the game by utilizing mana acceleration and devastating Eldrazi creatures. The key concept revolves around establishing a dominant board presence with big threats like Thought-Knot Seer and Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger, while disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Kozilek's Command and Karn, the Great Creator. By combining efficient removal spells like All Is Dust with ramp and powerful finishers, this deck seeks to overwhelm opponents and secure victory through sheer advantage and control.

The deck revolves around assembling UrzaTron lands to quickly ramp into powerful Eldrazi creatures like Thought-Knot Seer and Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger. It uses a mix of removal spells and artifacts like Karn, the Great Creator to control the board and disrupt the opponent's strategy. The deck also utilizes Sowing Mycospawn and Kozilek's Command for additional value and card advantage. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with large threats while maintaining control of the game through efficient removal and disruption.

This deck focuses on aggressive creature-based strategies in order to overwhelm opponents quickly and efficiently. The deck utilizes strong creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Territorial Kavu, along with powerful spells like Lightning Bolt and Tribal Flames to deal damage and control the board. The inclusion of Jegantha, the Wellspring as a companion adds an extra layer of versatility and consistency to the deck. By maintaining a fast pace and applying constant pressure, this deck aims to quickly defeat opponents before they have a chance to stabilize.

The deck focuses on utilizing lands like Urza's Saga, Gruul Turf, and Lotus Field to ramp up mana quickly in order to cast powerful cards like Primeval Titan and Amulet of Vigor. By combining land ramp and mana acceleration with cards that allow for additional land plays, the deck aims to quickly assemble a combo that can overwhelm the opponent with massive creatures and powerful effects. The goal is to create a board state that is difficult for the opponent to interact with, leading to a quick victory through overwhelming force.

This deck focuses on utilizing the synergy between Amulet of Vigor and The One Ring to ramp up quickly and efficiently into powerful threats like Primeval Titan and Cultivator Colossus. Arboreal Grazer and Aftermath Analyst provide early game acceleration, while cards like Expedition Map and Summoner's Pact help to find key pieces of the combo. The land package, including Urza's Saga and various utility lands, allows for versatile gameplay and the ability to consistently assemble the necessary pieces for explosive turns and overwhelming board presence.

The main concept of this Boros Aggro deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and powerful spells. Utilizing the companion Jegantha, the Wellspring allows for an extra boost to the deck's efficiency. Cards like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury and Ocelot Pride provide strong creature presence, while Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Lightning Bolt offer versatile removal options. The deck also includes control elements like Static Prison and The One Ring to disrupt the opponent's strategy. Overall, the key strategy is to establish board control early and maintain pressure throughout the game.

The main concept of this Boros Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with fast and aggressive creature drops, supported by powerful combat tricks and removal spells. The deck is focused on quickly building a board presence with efficient creatures like Guide of Souls and Ocelot Pride, while also utilizing cards like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and The One Ring to enhance their abilities. With the additional support of burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Static Prison, the deck aims to keep the pressure on the opponent and close out the game quickly before they have a chance to recover.

The deck aims to quickly assemble the combo pieces needed to effectively utilize Underworld Breach, Grinding Station, and Emry, Lurker of the Loch to generate a lethal amount of card advantage and eventually win the game. By utilizing fast mana sources such as Mishra's Bauble and Mox Amber, along with efficient interaction like Unholy Heat and Malevolent Rumble, the deck can disrupt opponents while setting up its game-winning combo. The inclusion of Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student adds consistency and card selection to the strategy, while cards like Thassa's Oracle provide alternative win conditions. Ultimately, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with its powerful combo potential.

This deck aims to quickly overwhelm the opponent with powerful creatures and spells, utilizing the Cascade mechanic to gain additional value and pressure the opponent early in the game. By combining aggressive creatures like Scion of Draco and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury with Cascade spells like Shardless Agent and Crashing Footfalls, the deck generates continuous threats while disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Subtlety and Force of Negation. Additionally, Leyline of the Guildpact and Leyline Binding provide additional support and protection for the deck's key creatures.

The main focus of this Dimir Control deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan while slowly building advantage through card advantage and efficient removal spells. Using a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and card draw, this deck aims to control the board and outvalue the opponent. The inclusion of hand disruption, card draw, and efficient removal tools like Fatal Push and Counterspell allows the deck to handle a variety of threats and adapt to different matchups. The deck also utilizes powerful finishers like Murktide Regent to close out games once the opponent's resources have been depleted.

This Dimir Control deck focuses on utilizing a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and card draw to control the game and outvalue the opponent. With a strong suite of counterspells like Counterspell, Force of Negation, and Archmage's Charm, backed up by removal spells like Fatal Push and Toxic Deluge, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while deploying threats like Murktide Regent and Harbinger of the Seas to close out the game. The deck also includes card draw spells like Preordain and Consider to keep the hand full and the options open.

The deck focuses on utilizing Eldrazi ramp cards to quickly generate a large amount of mana to cast powerful Eldrazi creatures such as Emrakul and Ulamog. It also includes control elements like counterspells and removal spells to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck aims to control the game early on and then ramp into massive threats that can quickly close out the game. It also includes card draw and manipulation to help find key pieces of the combo and maintain card advantage throughout the match.

The main concept of this Hollow One aggro deck is to quickly fill the graveyard with cards through cards like Burning Inquiry and Goblin Lore, enabling you to cast powerful threats like Hollow One and Ox of Agonas for free or at a reduced cost. With a mix of aggressive creatures like Dragon's Rage Channeler and Orcish Bowmasters, along with removal spells like Fatal Push and Lightning Bolt, the deck aims to apply early pressure and outpace the opponent before they can stabilize. The deck also utilizes Mishra's Bauble and Street Wraith to cycle through the deck and trigger Delirium for Nethergoyf.

The main idea of this deck is to use cards like Goryo's Vengeance and Ephemerate to cheat big creatures like Atraxa and Ulamog into play from the graveyard. This combo strategy allows the player to quickly reanimate powerful threats and overwhelm the opponent. Additionally, cards like Thoughtseize and Force of Negation provide disruption and protection for the combo pieces. The deck also includes cards like Tainted Indulgence and Psychic Frog to help with card draw and filtering. Overall, the deck aims to quickly assemble its combo pieces and win the game in a flashy and explosive manner.

This Mardu Aggro deck focuses on aggression and tempo. It utilizes low-cost creatures and powerful removal spells to quickly overwhelm the opponent. The inclusion of Jegantha, the Wellspring as a companion adds an extra layer of consistency and versatility to the deck. The deck also features strong creatures like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury and Ajani, Nacatl Pariah to apply pressure on the opponent. With cards like Goblin Bombardment and Fatal Push for removal, this deck aims to establish early board control and end the game quickly through efficient combat damage.

The main focus of this Mono Black Control deck is to disrupt and control the opponent's game plan through a combination of hand disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek, removal spells like Fatal Push and Fell the Profane, and powerful creatures like Dauthi Voidwalker and Sheoldred, the Apocalypse. The deck also utilizes cards like Necrodominance and Soul Spike for alternate win conditions. This deck aims to maintain control of the board while slowly wearing down the opponent's resources and ultimately emerging victorious.

This deck focuses on using control elements to protect and utilize The One Ring, a powerful artifact that can change the course of the game. By combining counterspells, removal, and card draw, the deck aims to control the board and disrupt the opponent's strategy while building up to a game-winning play with The One Ring. The deck also includes a mix of utility cards and additional win conditions, such as Teferi, Time Raveler and Wrath of the Skies, to further enhance its control capabilities and ensure victory.

This deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly with the UrzaTron lands to play powerful Eldrazi creatures like Thought-Knot Seer and Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger. It also utilizes control elements like All Is Dust and Kozilek's Command to disrupt the opponent's strategy. Karn, the Great Creator is used to search for important artifacts, while cards like Expedition Map and Eldrazi Temple help with consistency and efficiency. The deck aims to outvalue and outlast the opponent with its powerful creatures and disruptive spells.
